Literature.Title: Integrating Molecular Networking and 1H NMR To Target the Isolation of Chrysogeamides from a Library of Marine-Derived Penicillium Fungi.
Literature.Author: Hou XM, Li YY, Shi YW, Fang YW, Chao R, Gu YC, Wang CY, Shao CL

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Bacillus subtilis(MIC=>50µM),Bacillus cereus(MIC=25µM),Staphylococcus epidermidis(MIC=>50µM),Escherichia coli(MIC=>50µM),Vibrio parahaemolyticus(MIC=>50µM),Vibrio anguillarum(MIC=>50µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa(MIC=>50µM),Aeromonas hydrophila(MIC=>100µM),Aeromonas salmonicida(MIC=>100µM),Photobacterium halotolerans(MIC=50µM),Photobacterium angustum(MIC=>100µM),Enterobacter cloacae(MIC=>100µM),Enterobacter hormaechei(MIC=>100µM),Mycobacterium marinum(MIC=>100µM),Human cytomegalovirus (HCMV)(IC50=>100µM),HSV-1(IC50=>100),Human hepatocarcinoma BEL-7402(IC50=>100µM),Human hepatocellular carcinoma HepG2(IC50=26.81µM),Human hepatocarcinoma SMMC-7721(IC50=83.16µM),Human breast adenocarcinoma MCF-7(IC50=>100µM)
